content.title: Financial Assistance to the Fish Vendors Registered with the Directorate of Fisheries to Purchase the Accessories Required for Fish Vending
content.department: Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa
content.details: Financial Assistance to the Fish Vendors Registered with the Directorate of Fisheries to Purchase the Accessories Required for Fish Vending is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Under this scheme, Financial Assistance is provided to the fish vendors for the purchase of Crates, Weighing Balance, Insulated Box, Gloves, Stools, Platforms to keep Fish/ Shed/ Umbrella, Choppers, and Other Equipment related to Fish Vendor, so that the fish can be reached to the people in hygienic conditions. The applications are accepted only in offline mode.
benefits: 50% subsidy, limited to ₹10,000, on a unit cost of ₹20,000 for General Category
60% subsidy, limited to ₹12,000, on a unit cost of ₹20,000 for SC/ST/Woman Category
Beneficiary can avail of the scheme once every three years
eligibility: The applicant should be a Fish Vendor registered with the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should request the prescribed format of the application form from the department by paying ₹50. Fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents. Submit the application form to the Department of Fisheries or the official at BDO Office/Sub-Offices.
documents_required: Original Invoice from registered dealers for the purchase of accessories required for Fish Vending.
Identity Card (Fish Vendor) issued by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa.
Mandate Form along with Bank Pass Book.

faqs.question: What is the primary focus of the 'Financial Assistance to the Fish Vendors' scheme in Goa?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered fish vendors for purchasing accessories such as crates, weighing balance, insulated box, gloves, stool, platform, choppers, and other fish vending-related equipment.

faqs.question: What percentage of subsidy is provided to the General Category under the scheme, and what is the maximum limit?
faqs.answer: The General Category receives a 50% subsidy, capped at ₹10,000, on a unit cost of ₹20,000.

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary in the SC/ST/Woman category avail of the scheme more than once within a three-year period?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme allows beneficiaries to avail financial assistance only once every three years.

faqs.question: How can a fish vendor apply for the scheme, and what is the application fee?
faqs.answer: Interested applicants can request the prescribed application form by paying ₹50 to the Department of Fisheries.

faqs.question: What is the address for submitting the filled application form and documents?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted to the Department of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Patto Colony, Panaji Goa - 403 521, or to the official posted at BDO Office/Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.

faqs.question: Is there any age restriction or specific criteria for Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) in this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no age-related criteria, and there are no specific criteria for Persons with Disabilities (PwDs).

faqs.question: Can applications be submitted online, and what is the deadline for application submission?
faqs.answer: Applications are accepted only in offline mode, and there is no specified deadline for submission.

faqs.question: How much time does the Department take to address grievances, and where can complaints be lodged?
faqs.answer: Grievances are addressed within 30 days, and complaints can be lodged at dir-fish.goa@nic.in or through the Department's Grievance Redressal Officer.

faqs.question: What is the contact information for the Directorate of Fisheries in Goa?
faqs.answer: Directorate of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Panaji Goa. Tel: (O) 2224838 Tel: (Dir) 2227780; Fax: (0832)2231049, Email: dir-fish.goa@nic.in, Website: www.fisheries.goa.gov.in.

faqs.question: What equipment is covered under the scheme for fish vendors?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers the purchase of crates, weighing balance, insulated box, gloves, stool, platform, choppers, and other equipment related to fish vending.

faqs.question: What is the unit cost for the accessories covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The unit cost for the accessories is ₹20,000.

faqs.question: How is the subsidy amount calculated for the SC/ST/Woman category?
faqs.answer: The SC/ST/Woman category receives a 60% subsidy, capped at ₹12,000, on a unit cost of ₹20,000.
